byline.contributor: Alison Smale contributed reporting from Berlin.
byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and JAMES KANTER

abstract: Leaders of 28 nations that make up European Union assemble to discuss Great Britain's desire to leave bloc and strategies to deal with influx of migrants form Middle East and Africa across continent.
lead_paragraph: The leaders of the 28 nations are meeting in Brussels to confront issues over Britain and the migrant crisis that challenge the longtime goal of “ever closer union.”

headline.main: European Union Struggling With How to Keep Britain in the Fold
headline.print_headline: As E.U. Nations Meet, a Challenge on How to Keep Britain in the Fold

snippet: The leaders of the 28 nations are meeting in Brussels to confront issues over Britain and the migrant crisis that challenge the longtime goal of “ever closer union.”

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject
